articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Bier of Kim Yang Gon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Bier of Kim Yang Gon
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un visited the bier of Kim Yang Gon on Wednesday to express profound condolences over his death. 
					 Kim Jong Un paid silent tribute to Kim Yang Gon, revolutionary soldier faithful to the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 He looked round the bier in bitter grief over the loss of the dear revolutionary comrade who devoted all his wisdom and energies till the last moments of his life to the struggle for thoroughly carrying out the last instructions of the great leaders for national reunification true to the unitary leadership of the party with unshakable revolutionary faith as required by the crucial historic period for accomplishing the Juche-oriented revolutionary cause. 
					
					 He looked bitterly sorrowful, when seeing the face of the beloved comrade-in-arms. He said that the death of Kim Yang Gon, a faithful revolutionary soldier, was a great loss to the WPK and the revolution. Kim Yang Gon was his faithful helper and close comrade-in-arms whom nobody can replace, he said, adding that it seemed Kim Yang Gon would have risen up, his eyes open, if he had called Kim Yang Gon right now. He could hardly repress his bitter grief for a long while, his hands put on the cold body of the revolutionary comrade, noting he would not have felt so painful, if he had seen Kim Yang Gon pass away after warmly taking his hand even once as he had gone to his sorrow even without a word, leaving a lot of work to be done together unfulfilled. 
					
					 Our party and country will always remember the brilliant life of Kim Yang Gon who remained boundlessly loyal to the party and the revolution with steadfast faith in the justice of his cause, Kim Jong Un said. 
					
					 He met with family members of the deceased to express condolences over his death. He shook hands with each of them and took them to his arms, consoling and encouraging them. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kwak Pom Gi, O Su Yong, Kim Phyong Hae and Jo Yon Jun.

articles.title: Funeral of Late Kim Yang Gon Held
articles.content:
Funeral of Late Kim Yang Gon Held
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- A state funeral of Kim Yang Gon, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, took place here on Thursday.
					 Present there were senior party, state and army officials, members of the state funeral committee, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions and family members of the deceased.
					
					 Bereaved family members and members of the state funeral committee observed a moment's silence in memory of the deceased before his coffin was carried out of the Sojang Club.
					
					 The hearse left for the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery in Sinmi-ri.
					
					 Pyongyangites bid last farewell to Kim in profound grief.
					
					  The hearse arrived at the cemetery.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, said in a eulogy that the death of Kim Yang Gon, genuine revolutionary and able political activist, was a great loss to the party and people.
					
					 Though his heart stopped beating, the feats he performed for the party, the revolution, the country and its people will last forever, the eulogist stressed.
					
					 The remains of the deceased were buried and bereaved family members and senior officials of the WPK Central Committee spread earth on the grave. 
					
					 Placed before the grave was a wreath bearing the august name of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also laid were wreaths in the names of the C.C., the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 All the participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the deceased.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulations to Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulations to Raul Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba.
					 The message extended warm congratulations and comradely greetings to Raul Castro Ruz and, through him, to all the Cuban people on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution.
					
					 Our people are sincerely rejoiced over the great successes made by the fraternal Cuban people in their drive for carrying out the decision of the 6th Congress of the party under your correct leadership and will extend full support and solidarity to the Cuban people in their just struggle in the future, too, the message said, adding:
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between our two countries would steadily develop in the joint struggle for the victory of the cause of independence against imperialism, the socialist cause, I wholeheartedly wished you good health and greater success in your responsible work for leading the party, government and people of Cuba.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a floral basket to the Cuban embassy here on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution.
					 The floral basket was handed over to Cuban Ambassador Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo by an official concerned on Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Sent to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Different organs of the DPRK sent floral baskets to the Cuban embassy here on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution.
					 The floral baskets in the names of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of External Economic Relations and the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries were handed to Cuban Ambassador Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo on Thursday.

articles.title: Greetings to Sudanese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Sudanese President
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir, president of Sudan, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing the president and people of Sudan greater success in their work for peace and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives New Year Cards from Foreign Political Party, State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives New Year Cards from Foreign Political Party, State Leaders
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received New Year cards from foreign party and state leaders and figures on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 105 (2016).
					 Among them are the president of the Russian Federation, general secretary of the Communist Party of China who is the president of China, presidents of Mongolia, Syria, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Vietnam, Algeria and Angola, and captains regent of San Marino.
					
					 Kim Jong Un also received New Year cards from the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, the chairman of A Just Russia, the chairman of the C.C., the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia, the national secretary of the Socialist Workers' Party of the U.S., the director-general of the UNESCO and the chief of the Regional Office for South-East Asia of the WHO.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Mahmoud Abbas, president of the State of Palestine, on Dec. 24 on the New Year, Juche 105 (2016).
					 The president in his message extended the warmest greetings and best wishes to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the friendly Korean people on behalf of the Palestinian state and people and on his own behalf on the New Year.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the DPRK and its people progress and prosperity. 
					
					 He hoped that peace would settle in this land and people in the region would live in security and stability away from the disaster of war and disputes.
					
					 He extended the warmest congratulations and sincere blessings to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party Leader
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from Gennadi Zhuganov, chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on Dec. 28.
					 In the message the chairman congratulated Kim Jong Un on the New Year 2016 on behalf of the C.C., the Communist Party of the Russian Federation.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un and the Korean people good health, happiness, prosperity and fresh success in socialist construction.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian President
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Muhammadu Buhari, president of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, on Dec. 21.
					 In the message the president extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the friendly people of the DPRK on behalf of the Nigerian government and people and on his own behalf on the New Year, 2016.
					
					 He expressed the belief that the long-standing traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in all spheres in the hopeful New Year.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of the People's Democratic Republic of Algeria.
					 The gift was conveyed to the DPRK embassy in Beijing on Dec. 15.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 105 (2016).
					 They were handed over to an official concerned by Military, Naval and Air Attache of the Chinese embassy here Zhang Ping who is doyen of the military attaches corps on Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il from Bereaved Family of DPRK Hero
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il from Bereaved Family of DPRK Hero
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Jong Il Sim, a widow of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, sent a floral basket to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the New Year, Juche 105 (2016).
					 The floral basket was laid before the statues on Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Bereaved Family of DPRK Hero
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Bereaved Family of DPRK Hero
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Jong Il Sim, a widow of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, on Thursday on the New Year, Juche 105 (2016).

articles.title: Best Weightlifters of DPRK for 2015
articles.content:
Best Weightlifters of DPRK for 2015
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Weightlifting Association selected Om Yun Chol and Rim Jong Sim of Amnokgang and Kigwancha sports teams as the best man and woman weightlifters for 2015.
					 Om Yun Chol, an Olympic gold medalist, renewed a world record by jerking 171kg, thrice as heavy as his body, in the 56kg category and lifted 302 kg in total at the 2015 World Weightlifting Championship in November and thus became a thrice world championship holder.
					
					 Rim, also an Olympic gold medalist, won three silver medals in the women's 75kg jerk and snatch and total of the same championship, despite her injury.

articles.title: DPRK Makes Leap Forward by Dint of Single-minded Unity This Year: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Makes Leap Forward by Dint of Single-minded Unity This Year: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- All service personnel and people of the DPRK have achieved all victories and glory this year on the road of following and upholding the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) with one mind and will, says Rodong Sinmun in an article Thursday.
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK this year greeted the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the WPK as the great festivals of victors and single-minded unity, rallied close around the party.
					
					 The great victory made by the DPRK in the confrontation with the U.S. and the efforts to defend socialism this year is the victory of single-minded unity with which the party firmly believes in the army and people and they fully support and uphold the party's determination.
					
					 Monumental edifices built on this land this year are something which those countries being pride of developed economic capacity and science and technology dare not to do.
					
					 Hostile forces have become evermore undisguised in their economic, scientific and technological blockade to suffocate the DPRK economically and deteriorate the people's life. Under such situation, the DPRK built highest-level architectures and modern edifices for several months with its own efforts, technology and locally available resources. This is the miracle of history.
					
					 This year the single-minded unity of all the service personnel and people fascinated by the distinguished personality of Marshal Kim Jong Un as the great man has been immensely strengthened and its attraction and vitality further displayed.
					
					 This year's heroic advance goes to clearly prove that any challenge of the history and desperate efforts of the enemies can never block the advance of the service personnel and people rallied close around the party in one mind.

articles.title: S. Korea's Humiliating Diplomacy towards Japan Blamed
articles.content:
S. Korea's Humiliating Diplomacy towards Japan Blamed
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Twenty woman organizations and more than ninety organizations of south Korea and its branch of the Amnesty International (AI) issued a joint statement on Dec. 28 in denunciation of the south Korean authorities' humiliating diplomacy towards Japan.
					 The statement referred to the fact that the authorities confirmed the final settlement of the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and the settlement of the issue of the peace monument (girl statue) before the Japanese embassy and called on the world community to restrain the criticism of Japan.
					
					 The statement stressed that the above-said organizations would further pool their efforts with the victims of the sexual slavery and the civic and public at home and abroad for the correct settlement of the issue in order to make sure that the Japanese government certainly fulfill the state and legal responsibilities.

articles.title: Trade Union Branches Pledge General Strike in S. Korea
articles.content:
Trade Union Branches Pledge General Strike in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The Seoul, Kyonggi and Inchon regional headquarters of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a meeting outside the building of the ruling "Saenuri Party" in Youido, Seoul on Monday and pledged an all-out strike.
					 They demanded the conservative regime retract its plan to retrogressively revise the labor law and stop suppressing the public under the pretext of security.
					
					 Speakers accused the regime of trying to worsen the life of workers through the retrogressive law revision, adding that unionists in Kyonggi Province would take the lead in thwarting it.
					
					 So Yong Sok, chief of the Seoul branch of the Federation, said unionists would be firmly determined to conduct the campaign for bringing a world for workers.
					
					 A resolution read out there stressed that workers can never live together with the pro-tycoon dictatorial regime and the general strike of unionists would signal an end to the unpopular regime.
					
					 They said they will never step back in their struggle despite harsher suppression by the regime.

articles.title: Japanese, S. Korean Authorities Accused of Evading Responsibility for Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
articles.content:
Japanese, S. Korean Authorities Accused of Evading Responsibility for Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea conducted a protest action in Seoul on Dec. 28 to denounce the political collusion between the Japanese and south Korean authorities who evaded the responsibility for the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 The organization held a press conference outside the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
					
					 It branded the "agreement" reached between Japan and south Korea as a shameful act aimed at evading Japan's state and legal responsibility, the essence of settling the issue of sexual slavery, and cover up its past crimes with some pennies.
					
					 It said that the collusion between the two sides on Japan's past crimes will only intensify military nexus and incite Japan's reinvasion of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 At the end of the press conference the organization staged a peace action.

articles.title: Pyongyang Center Opens in Amur Region, Russia
articles.content:
Pyongyang Center Opens in Amur Region, Russia 
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Center opened at the Science Library in Amur Region, Russia on Dec. 24 to mark the 24th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and the fourth anniversary of Marshal Kim Jong Un's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA. 
					 On display in the venue of the opening ceremony were works of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un, books on their greatness and other books introducing Songun Korea. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were personages of the Blagoveshensk City Administration and the Science Library in Amur Region and other people. Officials of the DPRK mission in Khabarovsk were invited to the ceremony. 
					
					 Kosolapov, vice mayor of the Blagoveshensk City Administration, said that it is very important for the Far East Region to develop the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the Russian Federation and the DPRK. 
					
					 Dolgoruk, curator of the Science Library, said that the Pyongyang Center would help residents in Amur Region know better about the culture, tradition and development of the DPRK. 
					
					 A tablet of the Pyongyang Center was unveiled.

articles.title: DPRK's Significant Days Observed by Myanmar Political Figure
articles.content:
DPRK's Significant Days Observed by Myanmar Political Figure
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Parliamentarian Tha Win, member of the Central Committee and secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, released a statement on Dec. 24, the 4th anniversary of Marshal Kim Jong Un's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and the 98th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 He congratulated all the Korean people and service personnel on these meaningful days.
					
					 He said that the world progressives, together with the Korean people, are recollecting with deep emotion the great exploits and revolutionary career of Kim Jong Suk who brought up leader Kim Jong Il to be the successor to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Her desire for building a prosperous country has come true under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, Tha Win noted, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Un's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA is a special event which provided a sure guarantee for triumphant accomplishment of the cause of Songun revolution generation after generation.
					
					 Expressing belief that the Korean people would surely build a thriving nation and achieve national reunification under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un, I extend invariable support and solidarity to them.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Marked in Switzerland, Sweden
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Marked in Switzerland, Sweden
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- There took place a seminar on Marshal Kim Jong Un's work, meeting and book and photo exhibition in Switzerland and a meeting in Sweden on December 19 to celebrate the 24th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and the fourth anniversary of Kim Jong Un's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA and the 98th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
					 On display in the venues of the events were art pieces depicting the images of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and photos dealing with the exploits of the great leaders and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, and books and photos introducing the achievements made by the service personnel and people of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets and flowers before art pieces depicting the images of the great leaders and paid tribute to them. 
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, explained the main contents of the speech made by Kim Jong Un at the military parade and public procession of Pyongyang citizens celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, said he was rejoiced over the successes achieved in the DPRK and extended full support to the Korean people's struggle. 
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events.

articles.title: Name of DPRK Sounds Great: Russian Paper
articles.content:
Name of DPRK Sounds Great: Russian Paper
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- An article titled "The name of the DPRK sounds great" contributed by commentator and writer Rabrentsi Gurzhiyev of the Russian newspaper Zabtra was posted on the website of the newspaper Tribuna on Dec. 17. 
					 The article quoted Marshal Kim Jong Un as saying when giving field guidance to the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site that the DPRK has turned into a powerful nuclear weapons state ready to detonate self-reliant A-bomb and H-bomb to firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation.
					
					 The article continued:
					
					 The DPRK fought against the U.S.-led aggressors and stooges of 16 countries during the 1950 Korean war though it was very short of weaponry.
					
					 It existed in the de facto political and economic vacuum in the 1990s when the world socialist system collapsed. 
					
					 It not only overcame difficulties but courageously mounted successive attacks on the formidable enemies, stepping up economic development while promoting science and technology. 
					
					 Being much upset by its offensives, the West was perturbed by the source of such tremendous strength of the DPRK which was hard pressed for everything.
					
					 The DPRK, however, had access to nuclear weapons for self-defence, regardless of what the West and pro-Western politicians claimed. The modern weaponry of the DPRK serves as a strong and reliable means for defending not only the Korean Peninsula but the border of the Far East and adding to the potential of the defense capability of Russia adjoining the coast of the Pacific.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita feretro de difunto Kim Yang Gon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita feretro de difunto Kim Yang Gon
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En ocasion del fallecimiento de Kim Yang Gon, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un visito el dia 30 el feretro del difunto Kim Yang Gon y le expreso su profundo sentimiento de condolencias.
					El Mariscal guardo un momento de silencio en memoria de Kim Yang Gon, combatiente revolucionario fiel al Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					Recorrio el feretro con el alma dolorosa de haber perdido a un precioso camarada revolucionario quien con la invariable conviccion revolucionaria conforme a la demanda de la importante epoca historica del cumplimiento de la causa revolucionaria del Juche ha luchado dedicando toda su inteligencia y entusiasmo hasta ultimo momento de su vida para materializar cabalmente el legado de los grandes lideres en materia de la reunificacion de la patria en acato a la orientacion unica del partido.
					
					El Mariscal contemplo con la tristeza infinita la cara del querido camarada de armas y dijo que el fallecimiento de este soldado revolucionario fiel deviene una gran perdida de nuestro partido y revolucion. Y continuo que Kim Yang Gon fue su ayudante fiel e intimo companero de armas insustituible por nadie, le parece que Kim Yang Gon se levantara con ojos abiertos si lo llama ahora mismo. Subrayo que el se fue lastimosamente sin decir nada dejando atras muchos trabajos que debemos hacer mano a mano y no le doleria tanto el corazon si habia tomado apaciblemente su mano antes de que el se muriera.
					
					Y permanecio durante largo tiempo poniendo su mano sobre el enfriado cuerpo del companero revolucionario sin poder contener su sentimiento excitado.
					
					Asevero que el partido y la patria no olvidaran jamas la brillante vida de Kim Yang Gon quien fue infinitamente fiel al partido y la revolucion guardando la inconmovible conviccion sobre la justicia de su causa.
					
					Se reunio con los familiares del difunto y les expreso el sentimiento de condolencias. Y les dio las palabras de consuelo abrazandolos y tomando manos de cada uno de ellos.
					
					El Mariscal fue acompanado por Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kwak Pom Gi, O Su Yong, Kim Phyong Hae y Jo Yon Jun.

articles.title: Ceremonia funeral de difunto Kim Yang Gon
articles.content:
Ceremonia funeral de difunto Kim Yang Gon
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 31 en esta capital la ceremonia funeral de caracter nacional del difunto Kim Yang Gon, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					En la ceremonia funeral participaron los cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, los miembros del comite funeral nacional, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, el Consejo de Ministros, los ministerios y los organos centrales junto con los familiares del difunto.
					
					Ante la partida de convoy funebre, los familiares del difunto y los miembros del comite funeral nacional guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto.
					
					El carro funebre con el difunto partio hacia el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos en la Comuna de Sinmi.
					
					Los peatones capitalinos pararon sus pasos para expresar profundas condolencias.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra de condolencias, el secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, dijo que el deceso de Kim Yang Gon, verdadero revolucionario y competente activista politico, deviene una gran perdida para nuestro partido y pueblo. 
					
					Enfatizo que aunque el fallecio, quedaran para siempre sus proezas dejadas ante el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					Al enterrar los restos del difunto, sus familiares y cuadros directivos del Comite Central del PTC cubrieron con tierra el feretro del difunto. 
					
					Al pie de la tumba fue depositada una ofrenda floral a nombre del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Tambien, fueron colocadas las otras a nombre del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC. 
					
					Todos los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje a Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje a Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Jong Un, envio el dia 31 un mensaje de felicitacion al Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba, Raul Castro Ruz. 
					El texto senala:
					
					En ocasion del 57o aniversario del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana, extiendo a Vd. y, por su conducto, a todo el pueblo cubano mis calurosas felicitaciones y saludo camaraderil. 
					
					Nuestro pueblo se regocija sinceramente de que bajo la correcta direccion de Vd., el hermano pueblo cubano logra grandes exitos en la lucha por la ejecucion de la resolucion del VI Congreso del Partido, y enviara en futuro tambien el irrestricto apoyo y solidaridad a la justa lucha del pueblo cubano. 
					
					Convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran incesantemente en el camino de la lucha comun por la victoria de la causa de la independencia antiimperialista y la socialista, deseo de todo corazon a Vd. buena salud y mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades por dirigir el partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de Cuba.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia cesto de flores a embajada cubana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia cesto de flores a embajada cubana
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio un cesto de flores a la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea con motivo del 57o aniversario del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana.
					Un funcionario coreano lo entrego el dia 31 al embajador cubano Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo.
